newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Cloncurry copper output normal after flood.
newsitem.headline: Cloncurry copper output normal after flood.

text.p: Cloncurry Mining Co NL said on Monday copper production at its Great Australia mine near Cloncurry, Queensland, had returned to design levels after being suspended earlier this year due to flooding.
Production utilising the heap leaching process in the first three weeks of June averaged in excess of 110 tonnes of copper cathode a week, the company said.
"The current production levels are pleasing considering the recent increase in copper prices which have contributed to a significant increase in revenues generated from the project," the miner said.
Flooding in the Cloncurry area of north Queensland in February and March was described by the company as a "one-in-500-year event."
Cloncurry produced 4,055 tonnes of copper cathode in calendar 1996.
